Articles.Content:
Hello everybody,

just wanted to drop a note that the ASES institute (Avionics, Space Exploration and Science) has successfully launched its first Missions into outer space. Maranda Kerman and her collegues already visited LKO, Mun and Minmus in person and have also set up a small yet comfortable (read: enough snacks available) space station in LKO. Right now our scientists are working on a three-kerbonaut lander and a rocket able to carry it to Kerbins moons. Spaceward Ho!

P.S.: the dude behind ASES bought KSP when there was version 0.25 available, updated to 0.90 and now started all over with 1.0.2 final, running a science sandbox career for the first time.

P.P.S.: I really enjoy the writings of some KSP users, especially the Kold War story was fun to read!!

Welcome to the forums!

Let's see... You joined in October of last year, but this is your first post. Come in from the cold, lurker. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Happy landings!

> 
> Welcome to the forums!
> Let's see... You joined in October of last year, but this is your first post. Come in from the cold, lurker. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
> 
> Happy landings!

Yeah, was busy blowing up stuff and getting into the game ... ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)
